alert.note: Alert for Lincoln (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 12 at 2:48PM MDT until further notice by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Riverton has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Wyoming... Salt River affecting Lincoln County. .Warm temperatures will continue to melt snowpack and increase river flows. Smaller streams and tributaries flowing into the Salt River within Star Valley will continue to run near or above bankfull, and ponding of water in low-lying areas is likely through the weekend and into next week. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt is expected. * WHERE...Salt River near Etna. * WHEN...From this afternoon until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 4.5 feet, Small creeks and streams that flow through the towns of Freeedom and Fairview are at bankfull. Minor flooding along low lying areas in Freedom and Fariview is occurring. At 5.0 feet, Bankfull stage. Monitor high water along Swift Creek in northeastern and northern sections of Etna. Small creeks and streams are flooding in the towns of Freedom and Fairview. Minor flooding of ranchland/pastureland near Etna. At 5.5 feet, Flood stage. Low land flooding along Swift Creek in northeastern and northern sections of Etna. Low land flooding becomes more widespread upstream in the towns of Freedom and Fairview. Minor flooding of pastureland/ranchland. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:30 PM MDT Friday the stage was 4.7 feet. - Emergency management has reported elevated stream flows on the western side of the valley with agricultural flooding beginning for low lying areas this afternoon. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to around 5 feet Monday morning. It may then rise to flood stage later next week. - Action stage is 5.0 feet. - Flood stage is 5.5 feet. &&
info.instruction: If you are in the advisory area, remain alert to possible flooding or the possibility of the advisory being upgraded to a warning. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement.
